alert.note: Alert for Bell; Knox; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 30 at 7:13PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Bell, southwestern Knox and central Whitley Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 712 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Clio, or 7 miles northwest of Williamsburg, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Rockholds around 720 PM EDT. Perkins, Julip, Suttons Mill, Wilton, Lucky, Yaden, Verne and Dixie around 725 PM EDT. Permon, Clate, Gausdale, Louden, Indian Creek and Dishman Springs around 730 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Barbourville, Bryants Store, King, Hubbs, Swan Lake, Swanpond, Birdseye, Carpenter, Goins, Siler, Myrick, Trosper, Kayjay, Avis, Brush Creek, Wheeler, Artemus, Boone Heights, Baughman, Yeager, Ingram, Flat Lick, Himyar, Old Flat Lick and Davisburg. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 10 and 23. U.S. Highway 25 East in Knox County between mile markers 2 and 12. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
